definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: But small auctions can lead to low winning bids, and thus less profit.
sentences.chinese: 此外，小型拍賣會導致中標價過低，利潤從而減少。

sentences.english: The organizer put many valuable works of calligraphy, and paintings up for auction.
sentences.chinese: 這次拍賣會的主辦方會拿出多件珍貴的字畫參拍。

sentences.english: Pecsaetnastill taking bids for many of the positions? quite an auction.
sentences.chinese: 許多崗位待價而沽？這就是個拍賣會啊。

sentences.english: At auction the buyer bid and bought the wool for his mill.
sentences.chinese: 拍賣會上，買主競價，爲自己的工廠購置羊毛。

sentences.english: The auction will wind up this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午這個拍賣會就要落槌了。

sentences.english: But the wines that win the best prices at auction are those whose provenance is certain.
sentences.chinese: 在拍賣會上競得高價的名酒其來源也是真實可靠的。

sentences.english: Other star lots on offer include a full sheet of 80 Golden Monkey stamps in mint condition.
sentences.chinese: 本次拍賣會的精品還包括一版80枚全版金猴郵票。

sentences.english: He loves to collect antiques, so when there is an auction, he always go there readily.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡收藏古董，因此每當有拍賣會時總是欣然前往。

sentences.english: On Sunday afternoon, the auction will begin with sales of Karakul skins.
sentences.chinese: 星期天下午，拍賣會開始與卡拉庫爾皮銷售。

sentences.english: Then he goes to the same auction, knowing you’d be there.
sentences.chinese: 然後他去了同一個拍賣會，知道你會在那裏。

sentences.english: The auction last week was the first country's first devoted to cognac.
sentences.chinese: 最近這次拍賣會是中國首次干邑白蘭地專場拍賣會。

sentences.english: The auction last week was the first country's first devoted to cognac.
sentences.chinese: 最近這次拍賣會是中國首次干邑白蘭地專場拍賣會。

sentences.english: Chen’s works have also been auctioned at major auction houses in China.
sentences.chinese: 陳的作品有些已在中國主要的拍賣會上拍賣。

sentences.english: That’s exactly what it has done with contests.com, which sold during a live auction last night.
sentences.chinese: 已經被賣掉了，在昨晚的一個拍賣會上。

sentences.english: Me Ruellan is facing a thrilling and exciting challenge for his first Hong Kong Auction.
sentences.chinese: 而所有的葡萄酒珍品都是首次在拍賣會上被拍賣。

sentences.english: Ladies and gentlemen, ele to attend this auction today.
sentences.chinese: 先生女士們，歡迎出席今天的拍賣會。

definition: to auction/auction sale/to sell at a reduced price
sale price/negotiated price/price reached in an auction
specific topic (addressed by a book, lecture, TV program etc)/article, report or program etc on a specific topic
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
to collect in a museum or library/museum collection/library holdings
